column1: Read more about this American hero: https://t.co/jd90E1kXmA #CVN81

He may not have known it at the time but his incredible story helped further the cause of civil rights and secured him a well-deserved place in American history. May God bless the future sailors of the USS Doris Miller (CVN 81)!

His actions that day not only helped save lives they also earned him commendation from Secretary of the Navy Frank Knox and the Navy Cross which was presented to him personally by Admiral Chester Nimitz commander of the Pacific Fleet. https://t.co/k180zbHdri

Miller served in a segregated Navy and was prohibited from using guns simply because of his race. This didn’t stop him from springing into action and valiantly manning a Browning anti-aircraft machine gun until he ran out of ammunition during Japan’s attack on Pearl Harbor.

Tomorrow the @USNavy will officially name a future Gerald R. Ford-class aircraft carrier after Pearl Harbor hero Mess Attendant 2nd Class Doris “Dorie” Miller the first African American to receive the Navy Cross for valor. https://t.co/saf1mxb4pQ
America stands with those fighting for freedom of worship around the world!

Still it’s exactly what is happening to the persecuted Christians in the Middle East the Rohingya Muslims facing genocide in China and our Jewish friends and neighbors who have been threatened and harmed by anti-Semitism.
It’s hard to believe that in the year 2020 oppressive governments are still violating the fundamental religious rights of their citizens.
Today is #NationalReligiousFreedomDay – a chance to reaffirm our commitment to standing with those facing religious persecution across the globe. https://t.co/cq83YXZMgu
Thanks to Channel 11 in Fairbanks for covering my effort to protect our communities from dangerous #PFAS chemical contamination⬇️ https://t.co/Vyb293AJwz

#OTD in 1869 Wyoming became the first state in the union to grant women the right to vote and we celebrate the advocates who helped make it possible. Today the state is represented by @RepLizCheney a powerful voice for women but also my very good friend. God Bless Wyoming! https://t.co/yOhVsLvdcl

It is my great hope that these trailblazers continue to inspire future generations of women and girls to pursue careers in science that will take our country to new heights.
This bill which was signed into law yesterday awards these pioneers the Congressional Gold Medal to finally recognize their contributions to computing engineering programming and aeronautics.
For too long racial and gender barriers prevented these women from being recognized for their achievements which is why I was proud to cosponsor the Hidden Figures Congressional Gold Medal Act.
These women paved the way for generations of scientists and astronauts and without their talents @NASA may not be the impressive organization it is today.

Christine Darden Mary Jackson Katherine Johnson and Dorothy Vaughan devoted their lives and careers to pushing our country forward in the fields of science and space exploration. https://t.co/sEkLfTKLOv

As a veteran myself I’m very proud to have four fellow veterans on my staff and I’m grateful that three of them were able to join me today. There is no way we can fully repay them for their service but these care packages are just one small way to remind our troops of home.

Our troops deployed overseas make many sacrifices to keep our country safe and it’s important that they know how much we appreciate everything they do. Today my team and I joined @the_USO to help assemble care packages for deployed and deploying servicemembers. https://t.co/oopFYj3KK3

The timber harvest has historically been an important part of Alaska’s economy and I’m committed to making sure this renewable resource can support our families and communities for years to come.

This week we recognize the American forest products industry which employs more than 950k Americans directly and supports an additional 2.4 mil jobs. I sincerely believe that protecting forests and supporting a strong timber industry can go hand-in-hand. https://t.co/4es3wV0Np3

#OTD in 1867 Russia officially signed over the lands of AK to the U.S. From the history of our Indigenous communities to the stories of those who came to set down roots I hope you’ll help share your love of AK with your friends and family far and wide. Happy #AlaskaDay! https://t.co/yEnFjr45aK

Early this morning we lost my dear friend Congressman Elijah Cummings. Elijah was a good man a strong advocate for his constituents and he loved this institution and this country. Today the halls of Congress are emptier without him. May God bless him and his family. https://t.co/1VGk4XgPyK

244 years ago today the Continental Congress established the United States Navy and they’ve been keeping our waters safe and free ever since. Please join me in wishing a Happy Birthday to the Navy and thanking all who have served or are currently serving! https://t.co/Igvxikbdas
Renewable energy is a key component of American energy independence and Alaskans have my commitment that I’ll continue working to ensure that development in all forms is supported.
This bill was also signed into law ensuring Alaska continues to have the resources available to expand renewable hydro projects. Read more about that legislation here: https://t.co/M80V2cTezn
Additionally I authored legislation to correct an error made by the federal gov't that was preventing 25 acres of land from being utilized for the Swan Lake Hydro Project in Southeast.

Last Congress my legislation to expedite the expansion of the Terror Lake Hydro project on Kodiak Island was signed into law saving the Kodiak Electric Assn millions of dollars that almost certainly would have been passed on to ratepayers. Read more: https://t.co/b96nsqgTI3

Southeast Alaska is rich with opportunities for hydropower. In fact if these resources were fully utilized Southeast wouldn’t need to burn another gallon of diesel fuel. I’ve long supported an all-of-the-above energy approach that includes renewables such as hydropower.
As #NationalEnergyAwarenessMonth continues I wanted to take a moment to highlight the various energy resources and projects around our state. https://t.co/PX3X7QWSRa
I’ve heard my friend Dave Stieren is off to new and exciting opportunities. I’ll certainly miss our chats but had a great time talking in-studio on his show this week. https://t.co/QG4TuwATqe

State and federal coordination will be critical to restoring services and stabilizing the cost of electricity and I’ll be working in Congress to ensure the federal response is effective and doesn’t stand in the way of state efforts to get Kenai back online.
I joined @GovDunleavy and representatives from the AK Energy Authority on an aerial tour to get a better understanding of the work ahead to repair utilities in the area.

This summer the Swan Lake Fire devastated communities on the Kenai Peninsula and caused significant damage to the electric infrastructure in the region. It’s essential that we get power restored and electric lines repaired as soon as possible. https://t.co/QMSpJd3hGj

In addition to allowing for the resurgence of ISIS this move calls into question America’s commitment to our allies. We should be standing with the Kurds and against Turkish operations in Northern Syria.
The absence of American leadership overseas only serves to create voids that will be filled by America’s adversaries -- including Iran.

BREAKING: House Dems tried today to close #ANWR for good but they can’t stop the progress we’ve made. The ANWR Final EIS is complete and we’re one step closer to harnessing AK’s vast resources and helping America lead the world in energy production: https://t.co/Ger7xjJqM3 https://t.co/4eEGEoszne
Read my remarks against House Democrats’ anti-Alaska bill as prepared for the House Floor here: https://t.co/5xmeEliuCL

I am relieved that Alaskans have a Republican team in the Senate to protect our economy and land-use rights. Together I’ll keep working with the Alaska Delegation to defend against the extreme partisan interests that seek to destroy jobs and opportunity within our state.

This bill passed the House but make no mistake: it will not pass the Senate; it will not become law; it will serve only the interests of environmental lawyers and the ultra-liberal politicians who support these disastrous policies.

The 1002 Area of #ANWR was specifically set aside by Congress for resource exploration. Every Governor Senator and Congressman from Alaska – Republican Democrat and Independent – have supported exploration in our state but House Democrats simply aren’t listening.

Today @HouseDemocrats passed a sham bill. It’s all political theater -- a show -- and they know it. These politicians don’t think we can take care of our own state. It’s time for Alaskans to be allowed to take care of Alaska. https://t.co/vsapGyv67k

Senator @lisamurkowski @SenDanSullivan and I penned a joint op-ed highlighting the need to protect Alaska’s right to develop our lands from House Democrats attempting to close ANWR forever. Read our full op-ed here: https://t.co/tNg8drTR9L #ANWR
Curious about which unions and trade organizations lose out if the Democrats succeed in crushing American energy production? Click here: https://t.co/VyegDbZgIz @NRDems

I'd like to remind @HouseDemocrats that national labor unions -- that Democrats claim to support -- oppose their efforts to close #ANWR. Their bill will destroy well-paying jobs and threaten thousands of blue-collar workers. I'm fighting to make sure ANWR is open for business. https://t.co/vgXFVqSqGC
May God bless everyone lost on that fateful day and may God bless America.

We were united with a sense of patriotism and community and it is my great hope that we can honor those who were lost by recommitting ourselves to the values of unity freedom and service to our fellow Americans.
In the days that followed September 11th the American spirit stood strong and resolute.
May we also remember the firefighters police officers other first responders and everyday citizens who risked their lives storming burning buildings – with many never to return.

18 years ago America was attacked in an act of heinous terrorism and thousands of innocent lives were tragically cut short. We must never forget the victims and their families who continue to grieve to this day. https://t.co/ZhNtYbPwXK

We must stand up for Alaska and for the Native voices that @HouseDemocrats continue to ignore. Read more about why this Democrat-led effort ignores the basic rights of the Native communities on the coastal plain: https://t.co/WvdUijfF21 @NRDems

The State supports resource development in #ANWR. Alaskans support it. The Iñupiat who actually live there support it. Many of these Democrats haven't even been to Alaska and we can't let them roll back progress on a settled issue.

The Iñupiat on the North Slope call the Arctic home and I've been fighting for their right to benefit from resource development alongside them for years. This week @HouseDemocrats will push a bill telling these indigenous communities what they can and cannot do. It's wrong.

In Alaska we look out for one another. September is #NationalSuicidePreventionMonth and I wanted to take a moment to remind you of the resources available to you and your loved ones in our state. https://t.co/13uG2cbATy

For years I have said that the Roadless Rule was a disaster for Alaska. I have been working closely with @POTUS to secure an exemption for the #Tongass and it is my great hope that this work will finally lead to a lifting of this damaging policy. More:https://t.co/ogZYh51C6o
Read my full statement on today's news from BP and Hilcorp: https://t.co/S16WeWAZvJ

It is difficult to see them leave not only because of our strong shared history in Alaska but more critically because so many of our family members and friends have built great careers with this company.
Alaskans are committed to responsible energy development and BP has been a steadfast partner in this important cause.
For over 60 years @BP_Alaska has been an important part of Alaskan communities and a significant contributor to our state’s economy. I would like to thank them for their decades of service.

Americans enjoy Alaskan seafood affordable energy and beautiful tourist destinations far more than they enjoy cable news punditry. For @CillizzaCNN to say the AK Purchase “isn’t working out” is not only naive but insulting to the 739000 people who call Alaska home. https://t.co/DEH1T1bQk8

There is still much to do. Together let’s recommit ourselves to working toward a cure to finally #ENDALZ .
Our work continues this Congress which is why I’m cosponsoring the Younger Onset Alzheimer's Act which expands services available to those under age 60 who have been diagnosed with Alzheimer’s.

Proud to join @repdinatitus on legislation to help the @StateDept continue to promote inclusion for people with disabilities in communities across the world. Read more about our bill here: https://t.co/LAK3aLSwPw
Today I spoke from the House Floor against a Democrat-led effort to turn back the progress we’ve made both for Alaska and for American energy independence.

Many of my Democrat colleagues have never even stepped foot in our great state and yet have no problem trying to make decisions for Alaska. Opening up ANWR is a settled issue and for a long time ANWR exploration was also a bipartisan priority.

The State supports it. Alaskans support it. The Arctic Iñupiat who live there support it. And yet today House Democrats are once again trying to shut down oil exploration in ANWR -- telling Alaskans how they should be using their land. https://t.co/1l7VSezToT

I am humbled by the heroism and gallantry of these exceptional servicemen and I know we are all grateful for their sacrifice. May we never forget their memory.

Private Joseph P. Martinez was posthumously awarded the Medal of Honor for his sacrifice during the Battle of the Aleutian Islands. Though he was mortally wounded his heroism helped drive enemy combatants from the islands. Read more: https://t.co/7AiaI8KxOO https://t.co/WK61THTLFH

Staff Sergeant James Leroy Bondsteel of Willow was awarded the Medal of Honor by President Nixon for his bravery during the Vietnam War. Although wounded he refused medical attention and continued leading his men against the enemy. Read more: https://t.co/wUbV5CVQ54 https://t.co/rNTeYZMQDi

Despite a bullet shattering his arm and a grenade wounding his chest Staff Sergeant Van Winkle refused evacuation and continued leading his men against an enemy attack. Read more about this hero here: https://t.co/UyOJigLLOg #MedalofHonorDay

Staff Sergeant Archie Van Winkle who was born in In Juneau and retired in Ketchikan was awarded the Medal of Honor for conspicuous gallantry during his service in the Korean War. https://t.co/IBtYM7rREn
